title: Nortje, Ngidi included in South Africa's Champions Trophy squad - Cricbuzz
summary:
Nortje and Ngidi Selected for South Africa's Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: Mon, Jan 13, 2025

Source: Cricbuzz

Fast bowlers Anrich Nortje and Lungi Ngidi have been included in South Africa's 15-member squad for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy, despite both players dealing with injuries.

  • Nortje and Ngidi return after long injury layoffs.
  • Wiaan Mulder and Keshav Maharaj also included after missing previous matches.
  • Nortje was the highest wicket-taker for South Africa in the Men's World T20 final.
  • Gerald Coetzee misses out due to injury.
  • South Africa's first game is against Afghanistan on February 21.
Squad: Temba Bavuma (C), Tony de Zorzi, Marco Jansen, Heinrich Klaasen, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, David Miller, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, Ryan Rickelton, Tabraiz Shamsi, Tristan Stubbs, and Rassie van der Dussen.

Head coach Rob Walter confident the squad can progress further in the tournament.
newTitle: Nortje and Ngidi Selected for South Africa's Champions Trophy Squad

title: Shreyas Iyer Set To Create History, Will Become 1st Indian Cricketer To Captain 3 IPL Teams - News18
summary:
Shreyas Iyer Set To Create History, Will Become 1st Indian Cricketer To Captain 3 IPL Teams

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: News

Star Indian middle-order batter Shreyas Iyer has been appointed as the new captain of Punjab Kings for the 2025 IPL season, making him the first Indian cricketer to lead three IPL teams.

  • Iyer will captain Punjab Kings, which starts on March 21, 2025.
  • He previously captained Delhi Capitals and Kolkata Knight Riders.
  • Iyer was bought for Rs 26.75 crore during the IPL 2025 mega auction.
  • He is the only captain to lead two teams to IPL finals.
  • He has won 38 out of 70 IPL matches as captain, making him the sixth most successful captain in IPL history.
“Iyer has won 38 out of 70 IPL matches played so far as captain.”

This historic appointment highlights Iyer's significant role in the IPL and his leadership skills, as he takes on the challenge of leading another franchise.
newTitle: Shreyas Iyer Set To Create History, Will Become 1st Indian Cricketer To Captain 3 IPL Teams

title: EXCLUSIVE | 'India can make VVS Laxman Test coach, let Gautam Gambhir do white-ball duty,' suggests Monty - The Times of India
summary:
EXCLUSIVE | 'India can make VVS Laxman Test coach, let Gautam Gambhir do white-ball duty,' suggests Monty Panesar

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

Monty Panesar has suggested that India should appoint VVS Laxman as the Test coach while assigning Gautam Gambhir to handle white-ball formats. This dual approach could leverage their respective expertise in different formats of cricket.

  • Monty Panesar advocates splitting coaching duties for better team performance.
  • VVS Laxman has a strong background and knowledge in Test cricket.
  • Gautam Gambhir could bring fresh perspectives to the ODI and T20 formats.
“Having specialized coaches for each format could greatly enhance the team's overall performance,” says Panesar.

This suggested coaching structure could lead to a more focused training environment tailored to the specific demands of each format of the game.
newTitle: India's Coaching Future: Panesar Advocates for Laxman and Gambhir Roles

The Sydney Thunder will face the Perth Scorchers in Match 33 of the BBL at Sydney Showground Stadium. Sydney Thunder looks to recover after a series of losses, while the Scorchers are also in search of a win, struggling with their squad.

Khabib Nurmagomedov Clarifies Incident After Removal from Plane

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Khabib Nurmagomedov addresses the recent incident where he was removed from a flight, emphasizing his efforts to remain calm and respectful throughout the situation.

  • Nurmagomedov was removed from a plane prior to takeoff.
  • He insists on maintaining his composure during the incident.

“I did my best to stay calm and respectful.”

This incident raises questions about traveler rights and the responsibilities of passengers and airlines.

title: Rohit Sharma to play international cricket till Champions Trophy, unlikely to travel to England for Test series - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rohit Sharma to Continue Until Champions Trophy, Unlikely to Participate in England Test Series

Published on: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

India captain Rohit Sharma is set to play international cricket until the Champions Trophy, but is unlikely to travel to England for the upcoming Test series due to his recent performance struggles and family commitments.

  • Rohit Sharma scored just 164 runs at an average of over 10 in his last three series.
  • His performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy was criticized, sparking retirement discussions.
  • Rohit's statement during a recent match denying retirement did not quell discussions within the BCCI.
  • Reports indicate he may not travel to England for the Test series following the Champions Trophy.
  • Former cricketer Adam Gilchrist suggested his family commitments may impact his decision.
“I don’t see Rohit going to England... he’ll probably have a crack at the Champions Trophy, and that might see him out.” - Adam Gilchrist

This situation highlights the uncertainties surrounding Rohit Sharma's future in international cricket as he approaches a potential career transition.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma to Continue Until Champions Trophy, Unlikely to Participate in England Test Series

title: "If Virat Kohli Didn't Like Anyone, They Were Cut": Robin Uthappa's Explosive Remark - NDTV Sports
summary:
"If Virat Kohli Didn't Like Anyone, They Were Cut": Robin Uthappa's Explosive Remark

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: NDTV Sports

Former Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa has made controversial remarks regarding Virat Kohli's captaincy, suggesting that player selections were based on personal preferences. Uthappa pointed out that Ambati Rayudu was omitted from the 2019 ODI World Cup squad due to Kohli's disfavor.

  • Uthappa claims Kohli's personal opinions influenced team selections.
  • Rayudu was unexpectedly replaced before the 2019 World Cup.
  • The controversy surrounding Rayudu’s exclusion has been long-standing.
  • Uthappa has also accused Kohli of impacting Yuvraj Singh's selection.
"If he (Virat Kohli) didn't like anyone, he didn't feel someone is good, then they were cut... That wasn't fair according to me." - Robin Uthappa

The impact of personal biases in team selection remains a critical discussion in cricket, emphasizing the delicate balance of personal judgments and professional decisions.
newTitle: Robin Uthappa Critiques Virat Kohli's Selection Decisions

title: Manoj Tiwary Defends 'Hypocrite' Remark On Gautam Gambhir: "They Will Try..." - NDTV Sports
Gambhir wants Yashasvi Jaiswal as next India captain after Rohit Sharma, at loggerheads with Ajit Agarkar-led selectors - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gambhir Advocates for Yashasvi Jaiswal as Future India Captain Amid Selection Disputes

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

During a recent BCCI review meeting, Gautam Gambhir and the selector Ajit Agarkar identified potential successor for Rohit Sharma's captaincy but faced disagreements regarding the ideal candidate.

  • Rohit Sharma has indicated he will remain captain until a successor is officially appointed.
  • Gautam Gambhir supports Yashasvi Jaiswal for the role, while selectors are considering Rishabh Pant.
  • Rohit is confirmed to lead the ODIs during the upcoming Champions Trophy.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's potential captaincy is also discussed, highlighting the importance of a strong vice-captain.
  • Suryakumar Yadav is deemed less likely to take over ODI captaincy, given his needing to establish himself in the format.
“I will remain the captain until the board picks the next skipper in Tests and ODIs.” - Rohit Sharma

The decision regarding the next captain remains uncertain, exemplifying ongoing debates within the BCCI about leadership dynamics.
newTitle: Gambhir Advocates for Yashasvi Jaiswal as Future India Captain Amid Selection Disputes

title: "Hindi Language Is Like Aurat ": Yuvraj Singh's Father Yograj Slammed For Sexist Remarks - NDTV Sports
summary:
Hindi Language Is Like Aurat: Yuvraj Singh's Father Yograj Slammed For Sexist Remarks

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 Source: NDTV

Yograj Singh, father of cricketer Yuvraj Singh, has stirred controversy with his sexist remarks about the Hindi language and women's roles in society during a podcast.

  • Yograj stated that the Hindi language sounds like a woman speaking, implying it is less masculine.
  • He expressed that while women's Hindi is pleasant, men's Hindi raises questions about their identity.
  • Yograj also claimed that women should not be heads of households as they would 'destroy' them.
“Wife will destroy your house if you give her power. [...] Give them respect and love, but never give them power.” - Yograj Singh

His comments were met with backlash from social media users, highlighting the widespread disapproval of his views.

In conclusion, Yograj Singh's remarks reflect a troubling mindset that garners significant criticism, prompting discussions about gender roles in society.
newTitle: Yograj Singh Faces Backlash for Misogynistic Comments on Hindi and Women

title: Jasprit Bumrah, Kuldeep Yadav the reason behind India's delay in Champions Trophy squad announcement - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delay in India's Champions Trophy Squad Announcement Due to Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: HT Sports Desk

The announcement of India's Champions Trophy squad has been delayed due to fitness concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav, prompting discussions among selectors and management.

  • Other countries have announced their Champions Trophy squads, but India has not yet revealed theirs.
  • India's deadline to submit the provisional squad was January 12, but they sought an extension.
  • Chief selector Ajit Agarkar and the coaching staff met to finalize the squad amid uncertainty over the players' fitness.
  • Bumrah is recovering from back spasms and could miss the group-stage matches.
  • Kuldeep Yadav underwent surgery for a groin injury and is expected to return to fitness soon.
  • Selectors are considering including Bumrah, Kuldeep, and Mohammed Shami in the squad despite fitness concerns.
“All cricket boards had to send their preliminary teams by midnight of January 12.”

The delay in announcing the squad is a critical issue as it impacts preparations for the upcoming tournament.
newTitle: Delay in India's Champions Trophy Squad Announcement Due to Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav

title: Why Arjun Tendulkar REMOVED Yograj Singh as his coach after IPL selection? Yuvraj Singh's father breaks silence - India.com
summary:
Why Arjun Tendulkar REMOVED Yograj Singh as his coach after IPL selection? Yuvraj Singh's father breaks silence

Publication Date: Not specified Source: India.com

After being selected for the Indian Premier League (IPL), Arjun Tendulkar decided to part ways with his coach Yograj Singh, raising questions about the reasons behind this decision.

  • Arjun trained with Yograj Singh for 12 days before his IPL selection.
  • He scored a century for Goa in the Ranji Trophy, leading to his selection by Mumbai Indians for Rs 20 lakh.
  • Yograj cited his concern about his reputation and 'name sticking' to Arjun after the selection.
  • Yograj expressed that people feared that the association might overshadow Arjun's performance.
“When he scored a hundred on debut and returned to IPL, people feared that his name will stick with me,” Yograj Singh.

In conclusion, Arjun's decision emphasizes the complexities surrounding personal coaching relationships in the competitive landscape of professional sports.
newTitle: Why Arjun Tendulkar Removed Yograj Singh as Coach After IPL Selection

title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Complete list of squads and players of all 8 teams - Mint
Tsitsipas: 'I guess karma hit me' - ATP Tour
summary:
Stefanos Tsitsipas: 'I guess karma hit me'

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: ATP Tour

Greek tennis star Stefanos Tsitsipas expressed disappointment following his first-round loss at the Australian Open, reflecting on the irony of his decision to withdraw from doubles to conserve energy.

  • Tsitsipas lost to Alex Michelsen in four sets.
  • He withdrew from doubles to focus on his singles performance.
  • Tsitsipas mentioned that he felt karma affected his performance.
  • He compared his current mindset to when he reached the finals in 2023.
  • Tsitsipas emphasized he feels like a better player now despite the loss.
  • Currently ranked No. 12, he has started the season with two losses in three matches.
“The most frustrating part about losing in the first round of a Grand Slam is that you have way too much time to recover.”

Tsitsipas aims to reset and push forward for the remainder of the year after a tough start.
newTitle: Stefanos Tsitsipas Reflects on First-Round Loss at Australian Open

title: Kohli, Rohit to not face Iyer-Ishan treatment over Ranji snub; BCCI official says 'domestic cricket' move not a 'diktat' - Hindustan Times
Kohli, Rohit to not face Iyer-Ishan treatment over Ranji snub; BCCI official says 'domestic cricket' move not a 'diktat' - Hindustan Times
Last Played For India 8 Years Ago, Batter With Average Of 664, Back In Selection Fray: Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
Karun Nair's Remarkable Return to India's Test Selection Fray

Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

After nearly eight years since his last match for India, Karun Nair has turned his cricketing career around impressively and is reportedly in the fray for national selection again following exceptional performances in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • Nair scored an incredible 303 against England but fell out of India's plans for Test cricket.
  • He has remained unbeaten across six innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, with scores exceeding 600 runs.
  • Nair is among the few players to have five centuries in a single tournament edition.
  • His resurgence comes during a transitional phase for the Indian Test team, particularly with the nearing retirements of senior players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
“Dear cricket, give me one more chance.” — Karun Nair

Despite his struggles, Nair's determination and hard work have reignited his hopes for selection, thus highlighting the cyclical nature of sports careers.
newTitle: Karun Nair's Remarkable Return to India's Test Selection Fray

title: Pat Cummins to lead Australia at ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025 - ICC Cricket
summary:
Pat Cummins to Lead Australia at ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Sports News

The return of Pat Cummins headlines Australia's preliminary 15-player squad for the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025, to be held in Pakistan.

  • Pat Cummins will lead the team despite an ongoing ankle issue.
  • New inclusions: Matt Short, Aaron Hardie, and Nathan Ellis.
  • David Warner, Cameron Green, and Sean Abbott are replaced due to retirement and injury.
  • Australia will open its campaign against England on February 22, 2025, in Lahore.
  • The squad aims to end a 15-year drought since their last Champions Trophy win in 2009.
“This is a balanced and experienced squad with the core having been involved in previous competitions,” said George Bailey.

With a blend of experience and fresh talent, Australia aims for success in the upcoming Champions Trophy.
newTitle: Pat Cummins to Lead Australia at ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025

title: IPL begins March 21 weekend; WPL to start from February 7 - ESPNcricinfo
Robin Uthappa Blames Virat Kohli For Ambati Rayudu's Controversial Snub From India's 2019 WC Squad - News18
Michelsen upsets Tsitsipas at Australian Open - ATP Tour
summary:
Alex Michelsen Upsets Stefanos Tsitsipas at Australian Open

Date: January 13, 2025
Source: ATP Tour

Alex Michelsen produced a major upset by defeating 2023 finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas in a four-set match, marking his first win against a Top 20 player at a Grand Slam.

  • Michelsen won the match with scores of 7-5, 3-6, 6-2, 6-4.
  • The match included 46 winners from Michelsen, including eight aces.
  • Despite some drama in the fourth set with double faults, a crucial double fault from Tsitsipas at 5-all secured the win for Michelsen.
  • The victory propels Michelsen to a career-high No. 41 in the ATP rankings.
  • Michelsen is now 2-0 against Tsitsipas in their head-to-head encounters.
“I tried to stay super composed; I knew it would be a battle and I’m super happy to get through,” said Michelsen.

This win highlights Michelsen's potential as he progresses to face either Martin Landaluce or James McCabe in the next round.
newTitle: Alex Michelsen Upsets Stefanos Tsitsipas at Australian Open

title: IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25 - The Times of India
summary:
IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: Times of India

The 18th season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) will kick off on March 21 at Kolkata’s Eden Gardens, with the final set for May 25. This change comes after the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) adjusted the schedule from earlier proposed dates.

  • The IPL season will start a week later than initially announced.
  • Kolkata Knight Riders will host both the opener and the final at Eden Gardens.
  • The schedule change is reportedly due to broadcaster preferences to avoid overlap with the Champions Trophy.
  • The BCCI is expected to release the complete schedule shortly.
“The Indian squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy will likely be announced on January 19.”

This adjustment in schedule shows the influence of international cricket events on domestic leagues, highlighting the need for careful planning by the BCCI.
newTitle: IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25

title: Jasprit Bumrah Set To Lead India In England, These 2 Stars Captaincy Back-Ups: Report - NDTV Sports
Meet the new BCCI secretary, the adventure-loving Devajit Saikia and treasurer Prabhtej Bhatia, a beer baron - The Indian Express
summary:
Meet the New BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia and Treasurer Prabhtej Bhatia

Published on: January 12, 2025, Source: Indian Express

Devajit Saikia, an advocate and former wicket-keeper batsman from Assam, has been appointed the new secretary of the BCCI, while Prabhtej Singh Bhatia will serve as treasurer.

  • Saikia succeeds Jay Shah, who became the ICC chairman.
  • Bhatia is the son of the former president of the Chhattisgarh State Cricket Sangh.
  • Saikia has a legal background and was previously the joint-secretary of the BCCI.
  • Saikia and Bhatia took charge unopposed, reflecting confidence in their capabilities.
“The two elective posts of the office-bearers were uncontested, and it was not necessary to conduct a poll.” - A K Joti, Electoral Officer

This new leadership comes at a pivotal time for Indian cricket, addressing internal challenges as well as the performance of the national team.
newTitle: Meet the New BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia and Treasurer Prabhtej Bhatia

title: Jasprit Bumrah set to lose to Rishabh Pant or Yashasvi Jaiswal in Test captaincy race - Crictoday
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah's Captaincy Future in Doubt as Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal Emerge as Contenders

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

After leading India in the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy is in jeopardy due to ongoing fitness issues. With his future uncertain, Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal are emerging as potential candidates for the vice-captaincy.

  • Bumrah led India in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, but the team lost 1-3.
  • Concerns about his back spasms may hinder his participation in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.
  • The national selectors are contemplating a new vice-captain with Rohit Sharma nearing the end of his career.
  • Bumrah was recently injured during a match and will undergo rehabilitation in Bengaluru.
  • Selectors are preparing a Plan B in case Bumrah's fitness does not improve.
“While the selectors and team management are waiting for Bumrah’s recovery, the uncertainty around his fitness continues to raise doubts about his future as the team’s leader.”

The situation surrounding Bumrah's fitness highlights the challenges ahead for Indian cricket as they plan for the upcoming series and tournaments.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah's Captaincy Future in Doubt as Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal Emerge as Contenders

title: Cummins, Hazlewood included for Champions Trophy - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Cummins and Hazlewood Named in Australia's Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: February 10, 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have been included in Australia's squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy, with Cummins set to captain the team despite ongoing concerns about his ankle injury and Hazlewood's recovery from a calf injury.

The Australian squad includes a blend of experienced and younger players. Key details are highlighted below:

  • Pat Cummins is on paternity leave but remains captain for the Champions Trophy.
  • Josh Hazlewood is expected to recover in time from his calf injury.
  • Nathan Ellis has been selected as the fourth pace bowler.
  • Australia's first ODI against Sri Lanka is scheduled for February 13.
  • The squad features a mix of experienced players involved in previous international tournaments.
“This is a balanced and experienced squad with the core having been involved in the previous one-day World Cup,” said George Bailey, chair of selectors.

Australia's Champions Trophy begins with group matches against England, South Africa, and Afghanistan, leading up to the semi-finals and final in March.
newTitle: Cummins and Hazlewood Named in Australia's Champions Trophy Squad

title: Karun Nair on selectors' radar amid India's Kohli-Rohit situation after fourth straight century in Vijay Hazare Trophy - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karun Nair scored 664 runs in Vijay Hazare Trophy without being dismissed

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Karun Nair is back on the selectors' radar after an impressive run in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, scoring 664 runs without being dismissed. He has hit four consecutive centuries and is being considered for national selection.

  • Nair scored 664 runs in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, remaining unbeaten throughout.
  • He achieved four consecutive centuries, including an unbeaten score of 122 in the quarterfinals.
  • This performance marks the most runs scored in List A cricket without being dismissed.
  • Nair expressed his determination to return to the national team and has worked hard to secure his place.
“Everyone wants to play for their country and I’m no different. I would love to play Test matches again.”

Nair's excellent performance has drawn attention amid India's changing team dynamics, particularly with senior players struggling.
newTitle: Karun Nair's Stellar Performance Captures Selectors' Attention Amid Changes in Indian Cricket

title: 14-year-old Ira Jadhav smashes 346*, powers Mumbai to 544-run win in 50-over match - Hindustan Times
summary:
14-Year-Old Ira Jadhav Smashes 346*, Powers Mumbai to 544-Run Win in 50-Over Match

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: HT Sports Desk

Fourteen-year-old Ira Jadhav scored an astonishing 346 runs off just 157 balls, leading Mumbai to a resounding victory over Meghalaya in the Women's Under-19 One Day Trophy.

  • Ira Jadhav finished unbeaten on 346, contributing to Mumbai's total of 563 runs.
  • She hit 42 fours and 16 sixes, achieving a strike rate of 220.38.
  • Mumbai won the match by 544 runs, showcasing a dominant performance.
  • Despite her achievement, Jadhav did not break the record for the highest individual score in women's Under-19 matches.
  • She played pivotal partnerships, including a 274-run second wicket partnership.
  • Jadhav was previously unsold in the 2025 Women's Premier League auction and was later named as a standby for India's Under-19 T20 World Cup squad.
“Jadhav’s share in the partnership was a stunning 137 off 50 balls.”

This remarkable performance highlights Jadhav's potential in cricket, despite her young age and previous setbacks in auctions.
newTitle: 14-Year-Old Ira Jadhav Scores 346*, Leading Mumbai to a 544-Run Victory
